items.title: Fresh Holidays
items.description: It is November...my favorite month of the year. That time when you can still make it to the beach to keep that golden tan, but you can also sit outside in the evening wearing a long-sleeved shirt. It's also my birth month, so I'm a little biased there. I'm thinking about Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year's today - all of the great parties, time to catch up with neighbors and relax with co-workers. The time of year when you are constantly practicing gratitude for all you've been blessed

items.title: Sangria Sundays
items.description: My husband and I had a great day yesterday. He's a surfer so we got up early and spent a few hours at New Smyrna Beach in the morning. I wasn't quite ready to go back to Orlando and give up on the beautiful day yet, so I suggested we drive north to St. Augustine to see how they were faring a few weeks after Hurricane Matthew. Other than some lingering debris and a few waterfront hotels and homes still boarded up, on the surface everything looked great. I guess you don't get to be America's

items.title: A No-Regrets Wedding
items.description: I got married ten days ago after planning my wedding for no less than TWENTY FIVE YEARS! Yes, neighbors, I'm going to be the one to admit that I had a Pinterest page for my wedding even before I was engaged...worse, even before I met Donny Harkins, the love of my life. I planned before I was supposed to, then I planned some more, and worried, drove Don nuts, giggled with my girlfriends, budgeted with my parents, and finally that day arrived. October 15, 2016. And guess what? I REGRET NOTHING.

items.title: Love Thy Food Orlando
items.description:
Don’t miss the Next ORL Food Lab! Love Thy Food February 23 | 6:30-8:30 p.m. | PowerDMS Get inspired by the foodpreneurs of Orlando and get a delicious local meal while you’re at it! Enjoy one of Orlando’s tastiest entrepreneurial events, the ORL Food Lab! The ORL Food Lab is not your typical food event, but an evening of networking, eating, drinking and hearing from our local food community. Local restaurants, chefs, bloggers and more share their experiences (and their food) each month and prove once again that the Orlando […]

The post Love Thy Food Orlando appeared first on Orlando Food Lab.

items.title: It’s the Science of Wine!
items.description:
Sip, savor and support the mission of Orlando Science Center! Save the Date!* 7th Annual Science of Wine April 29, 2017 | 7:00 – 10:00 p.m. Whet your palate and your curiosity at one of Orlando’s largest wine events! The Science of Wine is not just another wine tasting, but an oenological odyssey with presentations on multiple aspects of wine growing and tasting as well as the opportunity to sample fine wines from the world’s major regions. Local restaurants will also be present to pair the wines […]

The post It’s the Science of Wine! appeared first on Orlando Food Lab.

items.title: Deadly Sins Brewing
items.description:
It’s never too late to begin your journey as a foodpreneur. Just ask Tom Adams of Deadly Sins Brewing located in Winter Park, Florida. At the age of 44, Tom has recently opened the brewery of his dreams. What was once an on-and-off again hobby has become a welcomed addition to Central Florida food community. Originally from Colorado, Tom attended some college in Alaska before moving to Seattle at the age of 23. While in Seattle, Tom joined the Navy, spending four years in Japan. Following […]

The post Deadly Sins Brewing appeared first on Orlando Food Lab.

items.title: Coffee, Travels and Orlando Stories
items.description:
Coffee, Travels and Orlando Stories We’re back Orlando! It’s 2017 and we’re bringing you another fantastic ORL Food Lab event! With top-notch foodprenuers, including Vita Luna Cafe, the Traveler foodtruck, Gideon’s Bakehouse and much more! Monday, January 23 6:30 PM – 08:30 PM Orlando PURCHASE TICKETS HERE Come for the food, the networking and the inspiring startup stories behind Orlando’s amazing food scene. It’s sure to be a good time!

The post Coffee, Travels and Orlando Stories appeared first on Orlando Food Lab.

items.title: Celebrate The Season With ORL Food Lab!
items.description:
Tis the Season to Celebrate Foodpreneurs! Don’t miss our annual ORL Food Lab Holiday event Monday, December 12th at 6:30pm at Power DMS in Orlando. Hear from the farming foodpreneurs of Orlando making National headlines, Fleet Farming. Chris Castro will tell us all about Fleet Farming and how you can get involved in this local movement. Also presenting is Mark Baratelli, the man behind The Daily City and the Food Truck bizarre. Baratelli has championed the local food truck movement in Central Florida and now is […]

The post Celebrate The Season With ORL Food Lab! appeared first on Orlando Food Lab.

items.title: The Farmacy Brings Local and Organic to Central Florida
items.description:
And now a word from our “Farmacists”…. “But we can’t miss the kale!”, is the simple phrase that would be the beginning of a dream come true. Florida natives, Cathy and Robby Clay have been in business nearly three years and they take great pride in their store, The Farmacy, nestled inside the city of Winter Garden, Florida. The Farmacy is best described as a small, local and organic grocery store. The Farmacy, however, is not your typical grocer carrying organic fruits, vegetables, meats, eggs […]

The post The Farmacy Brings Local and Organic to Central Florida appeared first on Orlando Food Lab.

items.title: All About that Base with Base Culture
items.description:
All about that Base?… well Jordann Windschauer certainly is with a food company like Base Culture. A native of St. Petersburg, Florida, Jordann began her food entrepreneur adventure at the ripe, young age of 22. Now at only 26, Base Culture has grown tremendously. What is Base Culture? From Paleo-friendly sandwich bread to almond butter brownies, Base Culture is a food company providing a wide, and delicious, array of Paleo baked goods. With a sweet tooth nearly as strong as her dead lift, Jordann Windschauer […]

The post All About that Base with Base Culture appeared first on Orlando Food Lab.

items.title: Thankful for Orlando’s Foodpreneurs
items.description:
What are you thankful for Orlando? We’re thankful for our Orlando Foodpreneurs, join us as we celebrate! Come and take part in our Orlando food community. Network and learn what’s new in the food world and hear from the folks leading the Orlando food scene – recently ranked number one in the nation! This month we welcome the duo behind Leguminati, serving food with a surprising twist and Dana Roquemore, lady boss behind The Dinner Party Project, the best time you ever had with a […]

The post Thankful for Orlando’s Foodpreneurs appeared first on Orlando Food Lab.

items.title: ORL Food Celebrates One Year!
items.description:
Mark Your Calendars for Our 1 Year Anniversary! That’s right, we’re one year and going strong, so come out and celebrate with us October 24th! More delicious details to come but get psyched to hear from some of your favorite foodpreneurs including John Rivers of 4 Rivers Smokehouse! And get ready to “Shake Your Juice Thing” with the gal behind New Moon Market, plus more delicious surprises to come! Monday, October 24th 6:30pm 1010 West Church Street Orlando Interested in becoming a vendor or sponsor? […]

The post ORL Food Celebrates One Year! appeared first on Orlando Food Lab.

items.title: Food Trucks & Foodpreneurs
items.description:
Uncle Matty’s Food Company Not all food entrepreneurs, or foodpreneurs, aspire to be chefs in Michelin star restaurants. Some look at the food business from a whole different mindset. Orlando based Matt Ryan is just such a culinarian. Ryan took his culinary skills in a new direction and utilizing his strong business and branding skills, he began Uncle Matty’s Food Company. Uncle Matty’s Food Company currently produces a line of sauces that are “revolutionizing flavors one palate at a time” but the future of Uncle […]

The post Food Trucks & Foodpreneurs appeared first on Orlando Food Lab.

items.title: Helping Residents Pursue Their Own Goals
items.description: One of the most important aspects of a life well-lived is the discovery and pursuit of one’s own goals and aspirations. For those of us who practice Asset-Based Community Development (ABCD), this is a fundamental part of the work – helping residents of a small geographic area leverage their skills and networks to realize their...

items.title: The Most Strategic Philanthropic Investment
items.description: The most strategic philanthropic investment in the U.S. goes towards revitalizing the distressed neighborhoods that are the source of most of our social issues. These neighborhoods are also full of people with aspirations and talents. Philanthropist and businessman Tom Cousins said it this way, “America’s greatest untapped resource is the human capital trapped in neighborhoods of concentrated...

items.title: Leadership: Unlocking Potential
items.description: Former basketball player and U.S. Senator Bill Bradley once said, “Leadership is unlocking people’s potential to become better.” So true. You could also say the same about a community. While leadership is certainly not the only ingredient in a community becoming better, it is easily the most important. And it is surprisingly undervalued. That may...

items.title: Using Art to Visualize Community Assets
items.description: Asset-Based Community Development (ABCD) involves leveraging what a community has to offer so that it can move itself towards a desired future. A first step in the process is typically some kind of inventory of what is there – talents of individuals, programs and facilities, informal groups, property – the whole nine yards. This information...

items.title: Asset-Based Surveys vs. Needs-Based Surveys
items.description: Door-to-door community surveys are commonplace, especially in low income areas. I recently heard a long-term resident of such a neighborhood say, “We’re like rats in a cage here. People always studying us, trying to fix us.” Universities, non-profits, community groups, government officials – everyone wants to know “What should we do to help people in...

items.title: Orlando – least economically segregated large metro
items.description: Orlando is the least economically segregated large metro area in the United States according to a recent report update from sociologist Richard Florida. This is good news for Orlando. Economic segregation, especially for the poor, has proven to be a significant social problem. Absent the social networks that open doors to the best of careers,...

items.title: Collaboration in Human Centered Design – The Lake Lorna Doone Park Initiative
items.description: Lake Lorna Doone Park, which is owned and managed by the City of Orlando, is being redesigned. Improving this historic park, which sits in the shadow of the Orlando Citrus Bowl, is a top priority for area residents as reported in surveys completed by Polis Institute in early 2014. As the year progressed, an action...

items.title: Community Transformation: Top Down or Bottom Up?
items.description: Polis often gets asked, “Does community transformation happen from the top down or the bottom up?” It might be surprising to hear that the answer is “yes.” It takes both, plus a concerted effort from the middle. This is what makes the Polis model distinct and effective. Bottom-up efforts tend to run into capacity issues...
